title: HTML forms in legacy browsers
summary: All web developers learn very quickly (and sometimes painfully) that the Web is a very rough place for them. Our worst curse is legacy browsers. Okay, let's admit it, when we said "legacy browser" we all have in mind "Internet Explorer", but they are far from the only ones. In the mobile world, when neither the browser nor the OS can be updated such as on older Android phones or iPhones, the stock browsers that don't update are also legacy browsers.
pageTitle: HTML forms in legacy browsers - Learn web development | MDN
